content.webTitle: FE diary: Grow your own sixth formers

fields.headline: Grow your own sixth formers
fields.bodyText: Sixth sense? Five Year Strategy for Children and Learners (are they mutually exclusive?), the DfES's 115-page insomnia antidote, is not entirely barren of interest. Indeed, it breezily tosses Tiddles to the pigeons in its throwaway line that all schools should be encouraged to grow their own sixth forms. Some may ask the point of those strategic area reviews being conducted up and down the land by local Learning and Skills Councils. Aren't they supposed to be making sense of the post-16 landscape by culling unfeasible and uneconomic sixth forms? The answer, of course, is that there's an election brewing. Bully beef Ali sounds a pretty cool place to work, if Mori, the polling people, have got it right. The Adult Learning Inspectorate headed by David Sherlock not only exceeds all norms for staff satisfaction, it finds itself among the top 10 employers who use Mori to find out how contented its workforce is. So, how does the other inspectorate compare? "We don't publish our staff survey," says Ofsted. A flavour of it, though, can be gauged in a statement by Ofsted boss David Bell, which begins: "We will continue to tackle bullying and harassment." This was prompted by a leak of the Ofsted staff survey that showed one in five employees complained they had been bullied or harassed and 63% felt so stressed that it was damaging their work. A net profit In 99% of the country, chirrup the folk at Ufi, the quondam University for Industry, you are never more than six miles from a learndirect or UK online centre. For fear of a house price boom in the other 1%, Ufi doesn't reveal where it is. Jargon buster "These benchmarks _do not duplicate other systems. They focus on and amplify some elements that may be found within them, while introducing specific, new dimensions." From a website explaining the matrix standard for organisations that give information and advice. Translation: Our benchmarks are pretty much like everyone else's.
